sources.title: The Great Chase
sources.description: The elaborate and fantastic gags that comprised the breathtaking, sidesplitting chase sequences in silent films -- using cars, trains, bicycles, horses and all manner of moving objects -- are shown off in this compilation documentary. Clips from several of the earliest shorts and features from 1903Â  through 1927 are used to chronicle the evolution of the chase, starring several of the era's greats, including Douglas Fairbanks, Lillian Gish and the greatest daredevil of them all, Buster Keaton.

metadata.Plot: A great compilation of the greatest chase/stunt/falls and dangerous sequences from the early years of cinema, long before stuntman become a real profession with more and more thrilling feats to be conquered. The documentary includes amazing stunts by the likes of Buster Keaton, Douglas Fairbanks, Lillian Gish and many others.
metadata.Writer: Harvey Cort, Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell
metadata.Actors: Lillian Gish, Douglas Fairbanks, William S. Hart
